data.title: TV show collects $190,000 for vulnerable children
data.meta_description: TEHRAN — An Iranian TV Show called Khandevaneh managed to collect a contribution of 7.6 billion rials (nearly $190,000) for children in 17 days, Tasnim news agency reported.
data.text:
TEHRAN — An Iranian TV Show called Khandevaneh managed to collect a contribution of 7.6 billion rials (nearly $190,000) for children in 17 days, Tasnim news agency reported.

On March 23, actor, screenwriter and director Payman Ma’adi, who was a guest to the show, asked the host to help solicit contributions for children who are suffering from malnutrition and lack of proper education, or whose parents are in jail due to involuntary crimes.

Since then a code was assigned to the good deed and by dialing it people could donate money as much as a quarter to $50 and finally on April 9 the contributions amounted to $190,000.

As promised, so far one third of the contributions have been spent on helping those who are jailed due to involuntary crimes.

MQ/MG
